headline: Rio Tinto hoses down Turquoise Hill takeover talk
text:
Rio Tinto has hosed down speculation that it has crept up the share register of Turquoise Hill Resources (TRQ), declaring that it has not changed its shareholding in the Canadian listed company.

Rio has owned just over 50 per cent of Turquoise Hill since January 2012, and has long been tipped to acquire the rest of the company which counts Mongolia's Oyu Tolgoi copper project as its flagship asset.

Share register data providers, including Bloomberg, were indicating on Thursday that Rio's stake in Turquoise Hill had increased by about 6 million shares.

That sparked a 7.5 per cent rise in TRQ shares in less than two days as investors suspected the long-awaited takeover might be finally underway.
